common

Interface IChatUser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChatUser, GameUser

    public interface IChatUser
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Was IConnect in HW08. A chatroom remote user, its stub is put in RMI registry. Only receives chat messages from another chatroom remote user. This remote user is essentially a remote-to-chatroom adapter. Well-known chat messages are: TextMessage, AddMe, RemoveMe, CommandRequest, CommandResponse, InitUserRequest, InitUserResponse, ChatUserInfoRequest, ChatUserInfoResponse.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BOUND_PORT_CLIENT
      The port that the client will use to communicate with the ICompute object.
      static int BOUND_PORT_SERVER
      The port that the server will use to communicate with the ICompute object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void receive(IChatUser sender, DataPacket<? extends IChatMessage> dp)
      Handles the chat message sent by another remote user.

    • Field Detail

      • BOUND_PORT_CLIENT

        static final int BOUND_PORT_CLIENT
        The port that the client will use to communicate with the ICompute object. Note that this port must be opened for incoming traffic on the server machine.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BOUND_PORT_SERVER

        static final int BOUND_PORT_SERVER
        The port that the server will use to communicate with the ICompute object. Note that this port must be opened for incoming traffic on the client machine.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • receive

        void receive(IChatUser sender,
             DataPacket<? extends IChatMessage> dp)
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Handles the chat message sent by another remote user.
        Parameters:
        sender - - user who sent this message.
        dp - - data packet being sent.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - - if this remote user could not be found.
